ticket.title: Parameter "-f" for "rails generate model" does not overwrite migration files
ticket.original-body:
Synopsis: The rails g model ... -f option states, "-f, [--force] # Overwrite files that already exist" but migration file is not overwritten if it already exists for the model and results in an error message.
Using: Rails 3.0.0 ruby 1.8.7 (2010-04-19 patchlevel 253) [i686-darwin10.4.0], MBARI 0x6770, Ruby Enterprise Edition 2010.02
Following these steps: $ rails new demo $ cd demo $ rails g model testmodel $ rails g model testmodel testfield:string -f
Receive error: Another migration is already named create_testmodels: /Users/<user>/development/demo/db/migrate/20100901231151_create_testmodels.rb
Work around: Delete migration file before regenerating model.

Receive error: Another migration is already named create_testmodels: /Users/<user>/development/demo/db/migrate/20100901231151_create_testmodels.rb

ticket.original-body-html:
Synopsis:
The rails g model ... -f option states, "-f, [--force] # Overwrite files that already exist" but migration file is not overwritten if it already exists for the model and results in an error message.

Using:
Rails 3.0.0
ruby 1.8.7 (2010-04-19 patchlevel 253) [i686-darwin10.4.0], MBARI 0x6770, Ruby Enterprise Edition 2010.02

Following these steps:
$ rails new demo
$ cd demo
$ rails g model testmodel
$ rails g model testmodel testfield:string -f

Receive error:
Another migration is already named create_testmodels: /Users//development/demo/db/migrate/20100901231151_create_testmodels.rb

Work around:
Delete migration file before regenerating model.

Synopsis:
The rails g model ... -f option states, "-f, [--force] # Overwrite files that already exist" but migration file is not overwritten if it already exists for the model and results in an error message.

Work around:

version.title: Parameter "-f" for "rails generate model" does not overwrite migration files

version.body: Here's a patch that makes `rails g model` and `rails g migration` remove the colliding migration file if you pass `--force` to it.
version.body-html: Here's a patch that makes rails g model and rails g migration remove the colliding migration file if you pass --force to it.
version.title: Parameter "-f" for "rails generate model" does not overwrite migration files

version.body:
(from [e8082246529737b6cf0d5cc3c948e54896aa1329]) Remove existing migration when using 'rails generate model' with --force [#5526 state:committed]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/e8082246529737b6cf0d5cc3c948e54896aa1329
version.body-html:
(from [e8082246529737b6cf0d5cc3c948e54896aa1329]) Remove existing migration when using 'rails generate model' with --force [#5526 state:committed]

Signed-off-by: José Valim jose.valim@gmail.com
